findings.title: Hard-coded API Key detected
findings.description:
Hard-coded API Key detected in source code. Secrets should never be stored in source code. Use environment variables or a secrets manager instead.

Code: const API_KEY = 'sk-1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef'
findings.mitigation: Remove hardcoded secrets and use environment variables or a secrets management solution.

findings.title: Hard-coded password detected
findings.description:
Hard-coded password detected in database configuration. Use environment variables instead.

Code: const DB_PASSWORD = 'admin123'
findings.mitigation: Store database credentials in environment variables or use a secrets manager.

findings.title: Dangerous eval() function usage
findings.description:
Dangerous function 'eval' detected. This can lead to code injection attacks if user input is passed to eval.

Code: eval(userInput)
findings.mitigation: Avoid using eval(). Use safer alternatives like JSON.parse() for parsing data.

findings.title: SQL Injection vulnerability
findings.description:
SQL Injection vulnerability detected. Use parameterized queries instead of string concatenation.

Code: const query = `SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ${userId}`
findings.mitigation: Use parameterized queries or prepared statements to prevent SQL injection.

findings.title: Sensitive data logged
findings.description:
Sensitive data (password) is being logged. Avoid logging passwords, tokens, or other sensitive information.

Code: console.log('User password:', password)
findings.mitigation: Remove sensitive data from log statements. Use log masking or filtering.
